A factory has two machines that make widgets. Machine A can make 120 widgets per hour, while Machine B can make 150 widgets per hour. If Machine A runs for 6 hours and Machine B runs for 4 hours, how many more widgets will Machine B have made than Machine A?

Machine A makes 120 widgets per hour * 6 hours = <<120*6=720>>720 widgets.
Machine B makes 150 widgets per hour * 4 hours = <<150*4=600>>600 widgets.
Machine A made 720 - 600 = <<720-600=120>>120 more widgets than Machine B.

A turtle travels at a rate of 1 mile every 2 hours. A rabbit travels at a rate of 4 miles per hour. The turtle has a 12 mile head start on the rabbit. How many hours will it take the rabbit to catch up to the turtle?

The turtle travels at a rate of 0.5 miles per hour, since it goes 1 mile every 2 hours.
In the time it takes the rabbit to catch up, the turtle will have traveled 0.5 miles per hour * h hours = <<0.5*h=0.5h>>0.5h miles beyond its initial 12 mile head start. 
The rabbit travels 4 miles per hour, so in h hours it will have gone 4 miles per hour * h hours = <<4*h=4h>>4h miles.
To catch up, the rabbit must travel the turtle's initial 12 mile lead plus the 0.5h miles the turtle travels in the meantime.
So, 4h = 12 + 0.5h
4h - 0.5h = 12
3.5h = 12
h = 12/3.5 = <<12/3.5=3.43>>3.43
Rounding to the nearest hour, it will take the rabbit <<round(3.43)=3>>3 hours to catch the turtle.

To convert minutes to hours:
